headline: Culture Strategist & C-Suite Executive Coach | Start-up Culture Expert | Transformational & Strategic Change Leadership | Founder Advisor | Ex-Amazon | Certified Dare To Lead™ Facilitator
about:
Pamela is a seasoned and innovative Culture Strategist and Executive Coach. Pamela believes intentional culture creation is a key differentiator for startups and fast-growing organizations. With AI becoming more and more sophisticated, emotional intelligence and human-centered leadership have to evolve to match this sophistication. Top performers want to be in cultures where they can be their authentic selves, create, and grow their craft. They want to be better at what they do, and as human beings, they have choices and very little tolerance for top-down incongruent organizations. The acceleration of remote and multigenerational workforces also means that the ability to connect and inspire is essential to execution. Leveraging her expertise in startup cultures and extensive experience in organizational development, Pamela helps executives and their organizations close the gap between who they declare themselves to be and who they truly are. High performance can be human-centered. 

Pamela graduated Magna Cum Laude with degrees in Psychology and Business Management. She has a Master’s degree in Human Development and a Ph.D. in Organizational Development and Change. Pamela received her professional coach training from the Coaches Training Institute in San Francisco, California, and is a proud graduate of their intensive Leadership program. Pamela is a respected member of their faculty and dedicated trainer of aspiring coaches. She is a PCC-credentialed member of the International Coaches Federation, a certified Immunity to Change Executive Coach, and a certified facilitator of Dr. Brené Brown's Dare to Lead content. Native English Speaker and fluent in Swedish, Pamela has lived In Switzerland, France, the US, and Sweden. Pamela currently shares her time between Sweden and the US. She is a proud mother of four, an avid chef, and world traveler.

experiences.companyName: Culture Strategist and C-Suite Executive Coach
experiences.description: Pamela partners with executives ready to disrupt habitual ways of leading, uncover blindspots, and develop the self-awareness and leadership skills to build inclusive human-centered cultures of innovation and high performance. As a seasoned executive coach and thought leader on culture and leading at scale, Pamela is committed to intentional culture creation, executive-level development, inclusive cultures, and human-centered high-performing organizations. Change is constant, and it can be lonely at the top. Pamela supports CEOs, startup founders, and executive teams to break through ambiguity and reactivity and reflect on their purpose, mission, motivations, leadership styles, mental models, and behavior to drive greater self-awareness, alignment, execution excellence, and cultural congruence. Through executive coaching and team development, she helps executive teams scale themselves and unleash the collective genius of their teams.

Our job is to ensure that our culture is strong and pervasive yet challenges each employee to be the best version of themselves by expanding and evolving with each and every culture-add (vs. culture-fit). We support the organization to walk the talk of our core values, and solidify the behaviors, systems, and symbols that allow those values to scale. We believe that people want to be authentic and purpose-driven. They want to make a difference and grow. People want to belong, be valued, invested in, and feel supported. They want to be surrounded by people they admire, respect, and can learn from. They want to be better for having worked at Outreach, both in their craft and as a human being. 

Outreach, the first and only Sales Execution Platform, helps revenue teams create and close pipeline effectively and predictably. Outreach brings intelligence to workflows and unlocks full visibility across the entire revenue cycle so sales leaders can commit to their forecasts with confidence.

As an Executive Development and Culture Thought Leader, Pamela codified and curated the peculiar and unique aspects of Amazon’s culture and built Amazon’s first-ever executive onboarding program (Escape Velocity); she also researched the concept of Day 1 vs. Day 2 and leveraged those insights to design and launch a global director-level program including a customized simulation for global executives focused on maintaining a start-up mentality and leading at scale (high-velocity decision making; pushing decisions down to the lowest possible level; and avoiding bureaucracy). headline: Global Corporate Communications & Marketing Leader | Executive Advisor | Public Speaking Coach | MBA | Board Member
about:
Becky Frost is a seasoned communications executive with over 18 years of experience driving strategic, integrated MarComm programs. She specializes in crafting high-impact messaging strategies that evolve with companies through every stage of their life cycle—from early-stage startups to established, publicly traded corporations.

With a background that includes serving as a spokesperson for a global FTSE 100 company, Frost possesses a deep understanding of how to shape and deliver powerful, resonant messages for diverse audiences, whether you're a high-growth startup or preparing for your IPO and beyond. Her expertise lies in developing messaging that aligns with market and competitive trends, strengthens brand positioning, and engages key stakeholders, from customers and employees to investors and analysts.

Her work also includes providing strategic crisis communications advisory, from her earliest agency days supporting Symantec, to working on the Experian Data Breach Resolution team, to a decade-long partnership with the Identity Theft Resource Center. As an in-house Comms leader, she's served on the Incident Response Committees. 

Becky’s approach is rooted in collaboration. She works closely with cross-functional teams—marketing, product, leadership, and investor relations—to ensure consistent and compelling narratives that drive both corporate initiatives and broader strategic goals. 

Frost has successfully helped early-stage startups amplify their voice, securing key media traction, while also assisting large-scale, global organizations with managing high-stakes communications. Her deep relationships within the media span industries like SaaS, FinTech, healthcare, HRTech, EdTech, and other innovation-driven sectors. Her clients have been featured in major outlets such as The Wall Street Journal, USA Today, and Forbes. 

From gaining early media exposure to refining messaging as a company moves toward an IPO, Frost ensures that her clients' stories are not only heard but resonate at every stage of their growth journey.

CORE COMPETENCIES
- Corporate Communications Strategy
- Media Relations & Share of Voice (SoV) Growth
- Crisis Management & Brand Protection
- Messaging Development 
- Investor & Analyst Relations
- Executive Communications & Thought Leadership
- Internal Communications & Employee Engagement
- Strategic Partnerships & Sponsorships
- Digital Transformation & Content Strategy
- Brand Management & Reputation Building
- M&A & IPO Communications
- Budget & P&L Management
- Inclusion & Belonging Initiatives

My work includes guiding messaging, securing top-tier media coverage, driving thought leadership, and building integrated programs that reinforce Outreach’s market leadership.

I also lead and develop our communications and creative teams, building scalable processes that improve coordination, transparency, and impact across the organization. headline: 🚀 PhD Candidate | Secure Edge Architect | Embedded AI Systems | Resilience & Runtime Monitoring | Cloud-to-Firmware Security
about:
I’m Ayush Pandey, a multidisciplinary systems engineer and researcher with deep experience building resilient, secure, and intelligent edge infrastructures for real-world federated systems.

My recent work involves developing a multi-layered cybersecurity and runtime integrity framework for protecting distributed edge platforms used in energy resilience and regulated sectors contexts. This includes:

Secure Systems Architecture Highlights
• Cryptographically verified boot chains using hardware fuse-based trust anchors
• TPM-based sealed key storage and disk encryption
• Real-time runtime observability using eBPF kernel instrumentation (CO-RE)
• Privacy-preserving telemetry using Post-Quantum and Homomorphic Encryption
• Swarm-level attestation and trust graph chaining
• Symbolic and formal verification of security guarantees using Coq and Tamarin

This architecture integrates embedded firmware, AI-powered telemetry pipelines, and cloud-based monitoring all tied together under a Zero Trust design model focused on resilience, attestability, and secure orchestration.

I bring expertise from both academia and industry spanning embedded development at Honeywell Aerospace, to edge/cloud AI deployments (Edge TPU, LSTM models, GCP), and secure dataflow automation.

Tech Stack: Embedded C, Python, Julia, SQL, TensorFlow, Docker, GitLab, Prometheus, Grafana, NetworkX, Coq, Tamarin

My goal is to design secure-by-design, self-defending systems that bridge the gap between low-level hardware and scalable AI-driven orchestration.

headline: Product Marketing Leader | Category Creator | B2B SaaS | Gartner Magic Quadrant Expert | GTM Strategy & Analyst Relations
about:
I build market categories that analysts adopt and competitors follow, then execute the programs that bring them to life.

Throughout my career at platform leaders like Catchpoint, ServiceNow, Oracle, and Microsoft, I've specialized in the "Complexity-to-Clarity" transition: turning fragmented product visions into dominant market categories through hands-on product marketing execution.

My approach combines strategic category design with tactical execution. I don't just define the vision, I build the messaging, create the content, enable the sales team, and manage the analyst relationships that make it real.

Core Expertise:

- Category Creation & Market Definition: Created 3 market categories formally adopted by Gartner, including Internet Performance Monitoring (IPM), Low Code Platform, and Enterprise Mobile Platforms

- Go-to-Market Execution: Drive end-to-end GTM programs including messaging, positioning, launches, competitive intelligence, sales enablement, and analyst relations

- Gartner Magic Quadrant Leadership: Hands-on analyst relations that positioned multiple companies as Leaders. I personally manage briefings, inquiries, and strategic positioning

- Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with product, sales, marketing, and executive teams to align around customer-centric strategies and execute with velocity

Currently at Catchpoint (acquired by LogicMonitor, Dec 2025), I built product marketing from the ground up and defined Internet Performance Monitoring for the AI era, driving category adoption, two consecutive years as a Gartner Leader, and 650% website traffic growth.

Whether it's defining a new category or executing a product launch, I combine strategic thinking with hands-on execution to deliver measurable results.

Skills: Product Marketing • Category Creation • Go-to-Market Strategy • Analyst Relations • Gartner Magic Quadrant • Solution Marketing • B2B SaaS • Sales Enablement • Competitive Intelligence • Messaging & Positioning • Product Launches • Content Marketing

experiences.title: Vice President, Product Marketing
experiences.description:
Defined a new market category and positioned Catchpoint as the recognized industry leader with analysts, customers, and the market.

- Played a central role in positioning Catchpoint for acquisition by LogicMonitor through category leadership and analyst credibility.
- Built and led Product Marketing from inception, establishing the function as a strategic driver of category creation, analyst leadership, and solution-led growth.
- Created and defined the Internet Performance Monitoring (IPM) category, including market narrative, messaging architecture, and use-case framework, resulting in formal recognition and adoption by Gartner.
- Owned analyst relations and executive engagement strategy, directly contributing to Catchpoint being named a Leader in the Gartner Digital Experience Monitoring Magic Quadrant for two consecutive years.
- Orchestrated a company-wide shift from product-centric GTM to five integrated solutions spanning sixteen customer use cases, aligning product, sales, and marketing around outcomes.
- Established Catchpoint as the authoritative voice in digital experience and internet performance through executive thought leadership, industry reports, and benchmark content, driving a 650% increase in website traffic over three years.
- Directed high-impact product launches across positioning, communications, sales enablement, content, and demand generation.
- Served as strategic partner to CEO, CMO, Product, and Sales leadership on category strategy, analyst positioning, and enterprise narrative
- Increased share of voice against the primary competitor from 20% to market-leading 53%, reinforcing category leadership and analyst visibility.

experiences.title: Vice President Product Marketing
experiences.description:
- Recruited to build and lead global product marketing, elevating the function from product support to strategic GTM leadership.
- Designed and led a company-wide shift from product-based to solution-led go-to-market, improving clarity for buyers and sales.
- Established core messaging, positioning, and campaigns across five solution pillars, aligning marketing, product, and sales execution.
- Built foundational product marketing processes, enabling scale across a global organization.

experiences.title: Sr. Director, Product Marketing
experiences.description:
- Recruited to build product marketing, go-to-market strategy, and market positioning for the Now Platform, ServiceNow’s foundational growth engine.
- Positioned the Now Platform as the “central nervous system” for digital transformation, contributing to ServiceNow being named #1 Most Innovative Company by Forbes (2018).
- Built and scaled product marketing to support multiple concurrent platform programs, executive evangelism, and global sales enablement.
- Defined messaging and campaigns for five core personas: Developer, Enterprise Architect, CIO, and Line of Business leaders.
- Grew the developer community 70% year over year for four consecutive years.
- Drove 7x Platform NNACV growth and 3x App Store growth over four years.
-  Led the Now Platform from zero to Leader in the Gartner High Productivity aPaaS (Low Code) Magic Quadrant in two years.
- Created and scaled CreatorCon, a 6,000+ attendee global developer event and centerpiece of Knowledge conference.
